intro: Cistanche afghanica, commonly known as the Afghan苁蓉, is a parasitic plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It lacks chlorophyll and relies entirely on host plants for nutrients, typically growing on the roots of various shrubs and trees. The plant produces yellowish to reddish flowers and has a distinctive, branched stem. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central and South Asia. Due to its medicinal properties, it is sometimes harvested for use in traditional herbal remedies.
